ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Then you will certainly see it with the Eye of Certainty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then you will see it with the eye of certainty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: again, you shall most certainly end up seeing it with absolute certainty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and you will see it with your own eyes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Again, indeed you will see it with certainty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And again, you shall see it with certainty of sight!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then you shall most certainly see it with the eye of certainty;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Again, you shall surely see it with the eye of certainty
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Aye, ye will behold it with sure vision.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: You would see it with the eye of certainty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then ye shall surely beholdwith the surety of vision.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Afterward you will surely see it with the eye of certainty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Again, ye shall see it with certainty of sight!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And again, you shall see it with certainty of sight!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Again, you shall surely see it with the sight of certainty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then you will see it with the eye of certainty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then you will surely see it with the eye of certainty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [102:7] Again, you will surely see it — [repeated] for emphasis — with the eye of certainty (‘ayna is a verbal noun, as both ra’ā and ‘āyana have the same meaning).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Aye, ye will behold it with sure vision) which cannot be missed on the Day of Judgement. 771
